data.headline: S&P 500 up 0.7%, Nasdaq gains 1.1%, Dow rises 0.6%, and Russell 2000 leads with a 1.3% jump as tech outperforms.
bullets: Nvidia rallies on news of a multi-year AI infrastructure partnership with Meta, boosting chip and software peers.
Analog Devices climbs after an earnings beat, while Cadence, Synopsys, Palantir, and Amazon also advance on AI momentum.
Apple rises on reports of accelerated AI-wearables development.
Wingstop, Garmin, Moderna, and MSG Sports trade higher, with MSG Sports lifted by a planned Knicks/Rangers split.
Palo Alto Networks drops 7–8% amid cybersecurity AI concerns; Genuine Parts underperforms.
Stronger-than-expected industrial production and durable goods orders offset mixed housing data.
Treasury yields hover near multi-week lows, the dollar remains firm, and gold trades above $4,900.
Light trading volumes persist as traders await FOMC minutes and monitor major AI investment headlines, including Elon Musk’s xAI securing $3 billion in Saudi-backed funding.
